title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Eastern, Southern and Uva provinces and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliyaand Polonnaruwa districts.

title: UK, European leaders join forces to draft Ukraine peace plan to take to US
byline: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Sunday European leaders had agreed to draw up a Ukraine peace plan to present to the United States, a vital step for Washington to be able to offer security guarantees that Kyiv says are essential to deter Russia.

title: ‘Anora’ filmmaker Sean Baker wins Oscar for Best Director
byline: Filmmaker Sean Baker won the Academy Award for best director for “Anora,” a film about an exotic dancer and sex worker who has the chance of a Cinderella story when she marries the son of a Russian oligarch.

title: Three arrested in connection with double murder in Baddegama
byline: Three suspects have been arrested in connection with the murder of two individuals in the Ethkandura area of the Baddegama Police Division, following a violent clash between two groups.

title: World Wildlife Day: All you need to know
byline: Every year on March 3, people celebrate World Wildlife Day to honour the beauty of nature and raise awareness about the need to protect animals, plants, and ecosystems.

title: Sri Lanka wins silver medal at Universal Massage Championship
byline: Sri Lankan massage therapist Praneeth Lasantha made history by securing the silver medal at the 2025 Universal Massage Championship in Thailand, marking the first time Sri Lanka has won a medal in an international massage competition.

title: ‘I’m Still Here’ makes history as first Brazilian film to win best international feature
byline: Brazilian movie “I’m Still Here“, set against the backdrop of the military dictatorship and recounting the true story of a mother of five whose husband disappears, made history on Sunday by earning Brazil its first Oscar in a major category.

title: ‘You didn’t drop Adani, Adani dropped you’: Mano Ganesan slams govt
byline: Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) leader and opposition MP Mano Ganesan on Saturday slammed the Sri Lankan government over the exit of Adani Green Energy from the island nation, saying that it has sent the wrong signal to the world.

title: Sri Lanka revises train schedules to mitigate elephant-train collisions
byline: Sri Lanka Railways has announced new speed limits and revised train schedules for night operations in areas where elephant crossings are common, in order to prevent frequent elephant-train collisions.

title: Suspect arrested with Kerala cannabis worth over Rs. 12 mln in Mannar
byline: Sri Lanka Navy has arrested a suspect along with over 31kg of Kerala cannabis in the Marichchakatti area of Mannar on Sunday (02).

title: Nominations period for 2025 LG Elections announced
byline: The nominations for the 2025 Local Government Elections will be accepted from March 17, 2025, the Elections Commission announced.

title: Elephant critically injured after train collision in Manampitiya
byline: A wild elephant is reported to be in critical condition after being hit by a Batticaloa-Colombo train near the Mahaweli Bridge in Manampitiya at around 8.30 a.m. on Monday (03), according to officials from the Manampitiya Wildlife Office.

title: CID investigates alleged plot to disrupt fuel distribution
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched an investigation into a complaint regarding an alleged attempt to disrupt the country’s fuel distribution process, Sri Lanka Police confirmed.

title: Sri Lanka’s tourism earnings surge to $400 million in January 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism industry recorded earnings of $400.7 million in January 2025, according to the latest data from the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Trump signs order designating English as official language of US
byline: President Donald Trump signed on Saturday an executive order designating English as the official language of the United States.

title: School van crashes into tree in Kuruwita, injuring several students
byline: A accident has occurred this morning (March 3) in the Adawikanda area of the Kuruwita Police Division when a school van traveling from Erathna to Adawikanda lost control and crashed into a tree.

title: UK launches investigation into TikTok, Reddit over children’s personal data practices
byline: Britain’s privacy watchdog, the Information Commissioner’s Office, on Monday launched an investigation into how TikTok, Reddit and online image sharing website Imgur safeguard children’s privacy.

title: GMOA warns of island-wide strike from March 5
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) warns that they will launch an island-wide strike starting from March 05, if the government does not provide a positive response regarding the cuts in additional duty and holiday allowances for government medical officers.

title: 36-year-old mother-of-three sentenced to life in prison for drug possession
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced a 36-year-old mother-of-three to life imprisonment after finding her guilty of possessing and trafficking heroin.

title: Stock market slumps as ASPI drops by over 300 points
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) faced a significant decline today (03), with the key indices recording sharp drops.

title: Petition filed seeking action to prevent elephant-train collisions
byline: A Fundamental Rights (FR) petition has been filed before the Supreme Court, requesting a formal program to minimize elephant collisions with trains and a ruling that government authorities have violated fundamental human rights by failing to take appropriate action.

title: Govt. mulls action against SLTB drivers bypassing schoolchildren and citizens with season tickets
byline: Discussions have been held at the Ministerial Consultative Committee on Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation, regarding Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus drivers who operate services while bypassing schoolchildren and citizens with season tickets.

title: Fuel distributors to accept petroleum orders for tomorrow
byline: The Petroleum Distributors’ Association has decided to place orders for petroleum products for tomorrow (04).

title: Release of water to farmlands for ‘Yala’ season after March 15
byline: The release of water to farmlands for commencement of ‘Yala’ season after March 15 has been discussed at the Ministerial Consultative Committee on Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation.

title: Colombo sees 7.7% land price surge
byline: Property in Sri Lanka’s Colombo had risen 7.7 per cent in the second half of 2024 from a year earlier, according to a Land Valuation Indicator. According to the report, industrial land had risen 3.9 per cent in the first six months compared to a year earlier. Residential land had risen 9.9 per cent, and commercial land had risen 9.4%.

title: UK says several proposals for Ukraine ceasefire on table after France floats one-month truce
byline: Britain said on Monday there were several possible proposals on the table for a possible Ukraine ceasefire, after France floated a proposal for a month-long initial truce that could pave the way for peace talks.

title: Kieran Culkin wins best supporting actor at the Oscars, completing his sweep
byline: Kieran Culkin won the Oscar for best supporting actor Sunday at the 97th Academy Awards, completing a sweep of the category that followed his dominance in television awards last season.

title: Distributors claim attempt to transfer CPC filling stations to foreign companies
byline: The Petroleum Distributors’ Association has expressed concerns that the government is attempting to transfer filling stations owned by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) to foreign companies.

title: Zoe Saldaña wins best supporting actress Oscar for ‘Emilia Pérez’
byline: Zoe Saldaña earned her first Academy Award for best supporting actress in “Emilia Pérez,” capping an already accomplished awards season Sunday.

title: Ranil Wickremesinghe predicts India as global superpower by 2050
byline: Former Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe asserted that India has reached its “takeoff point” toward becoming an economic superpower. Speaking at the NXT 2025 Conclave in New Delhi, he predicted that by 2050, India would emerge as one of the three global superpowers, alongside the United States and China.

title: Adrien Brody wins best actor for ‘The Brutalist,’ his second Oscar
byline: Adrien Brody won his second best actor Oscar on Sunday for playing an immigrant architect in the epic postwar drama “The Brutalist.”

title: Mikey Madison wins best actress Oscar for ‘Anora’
byline: Mikey Madison claimed her first Academy Award on Sunday, winning best actress for her role as a sex worker who marries the son of a Russian oligarch in the drama “Anora.”

title: Namal vows to present motion over misuse of parliamentary privileges
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa says that if the government fails to take action to prevent the misuse of parliamentary privileges to make false statements in parliament, he will present a Private Member’s Motion to address the issue.

title: ‘Anora’ wins best picture at 97th Academy Awards
byline: “Anora,” a strip club Cinderella story without the fairy tale ending, was crowned best picture at the 97th Academy Awards on Sunday, handing Sean Baker’s gritty, Brooklyn-set screwball farce Hollywood’s top prize.
